intro: Tampoa guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana tampoa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Tampoa guyanensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
